palette.title: bRoth and Roux
palette.description:
Painting untitled from 1958 or so, by Mark Rothko. Completed for the APC. This palette derives its name from a pun involving the artists' name, and the appearance of the colors. The brown tones reminded me of a good soup broth or roux; the title is a double-pun, involving both the artists' name and a slight mispronunciation of the word "you." See? Funny :)
(or maybe just funny to me because it's so late...)
